metadata.Title: CVE-2021-25804 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A NULL-pointer dereference in "Open" in avi.c of VideoLAN VLC Media Player 3.0.11 can a denial of service (DOS) in the application.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25804` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.16-1build7
libvlc5 - 3.0.16-1build7
libvlccore9 - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-bin - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-data - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-l10n - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.16-1build7
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.16-1build7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.16-1build7').
